Subjective: Headache x2 months, worsening in frequency (now weekly). Location: primarily Right-sided, but can be diffuse. Character: Simmering, lasts for days. Associated symptoms: Nausea (when severe), glare in vision. Triggers: Prefers dark, quiet room (photophobia/phonophobia). Meds: Occasional Paracetamol, Ibuprofen (works well). Impact: Unable to socialize (e.g., play volleyball, drink beer with friends). Family Hx: Father (migraines), Grandfather (cluster headaches). No family hx of tumors. Social: Occasional alcohol (2-3 beers/session), no smoking, no drugs. Student (medicine). Pertinent Negatives: No vomiting, no flashes of light, no recent stress. ICE: Wants to know diagnosis (migraine vs cluster?) and management plan.
Objective: Vitals: BP 120/80, Pulse 50/min. Neuro Exam: Cranial nerves intact. Finger-nose test normal. Strength in arms/legs normal. Romberg's normal. Gait: slightly off but manageable.
Assessment: Suspected Migraine. Cluster headache less likely.
Plan: 1. Education: Read information on thuisarts.nl about migraines. 2. Medication: Start pain relief immediately at symptom onset. Start with Paracetamol (up to 4x2 tablets). Add Ibuprofen if needed. 3. Monitoring: Keep a headache diary to identify patterns and triggers. 4. Follow-up: Return in 4 weeks to review diary. 5. Safety Net: Return sooner if symptoms worsen significantly or change.
